Class: Material

goo\renderer/Material

A Material defines the look of an object

new Material(String name)

Member summary

Object blendState
Object cullState

Specification of culling for this Material.
Object depthState
boolean dualTransparency

Render the mesh twice with front/back-facing for double transparency rendering
object materialState
String name
Object offsetState
number renderQueue

Determines the order in which an object is drawn. There are four pre-defined render queues:


  • RenderQueue.BACKGROUND = Rendered before any other objects. Commonly used for skyboxes and the likes (0-999)
  • RenderQueue.OPAQUE = Used for most objects, typically opaque geometry. Rendered front to back (1000-1999)
  • RenderQueue.TRANSPARENT = For all alpha-blended objects. Rendered back to front (2000-2999)
  • RenderQueue.OVERLAY = For overlay effects like lens-flares etc (3000+)

By default materials use the render queue of the shader. See Shader or RenderQueue for more info
Shader shader

Shader to use when rendering
Object uniforms

Possible overrides for shader uniforms
boolean wireframe

Show wireframe on this material

Method summary

<static> clearShaderCache ()

Clears the shader cache.
<static> Material createMaterial (ShaderDefinition shaderDefinition, String name = DefaultMaterial)

Creates a new Material object and sets the shader by calling createShader with the shaderDefinition

Members

blendState :Object

Properties:
Name Type Description
blending String

possible values: 'NoBlending', 'AdditiveBlending', 'SubtractiveBlending', 'MultiplyBlending', 'CustomBlending'
blendEquation String

possible values: 'AddEquation', 'SubtractEquation', 'ReverseSubtractEquation'
blendSrc String

possible values: 'SrcAlphaFactor', 'ZeroFactor', 'OneFactor', 'SrcColorFactor', 'OneMinusSrcColorFactor', 'OneMinusSrcAlphaFactor', 'OneMinusDstAlphaFactor''DstColorFactor', 'OneMinusDstColorFactor', 'SrcAlphaSaturateFactor', 'DstAlphaFactor'
blendDst String

possible values: 'SrcAlphaFactor', 'ZeroFactor', 'OneFactor', 'SrcColorFactor', 'OneMinusSrcColorFactor', 'OneMinusSrcAlphaFactor', 'OneMinusDstAlphaFactor''DstColorFactor', 'OneMinusDstColorFactor', 'DstAlphaFactor'

cullState :Object

Specification of culling for this Material.

Properties:
Name Type Description
enabled boolean
cullFace String

possible values: 'Front', 'Back', 'FrontAndBack', default 'Back'
frontFace String

possible values: 'CW' (clockwise) and 'CCW' (counterclockwise - default)

depthState :Object

Properties:
Name Type Description
enabled boolean

default: true
write boolean

default: true

dualTransparency :boolean

Render the mesh twice with front/back-facing for double transparency rendering

Default Value:
  • false

Properties:
Name Type Description
ambient Array<Number>

The ambient color, [r,g,b,a]

The diffuse color, [r,g,b,a]
emissive Array<Number>

The emissive color, [r,g,b,a]
specular Array<Number>

The specular color, [r,g,b,a]
shininess Number

The shininess exponent.

name :String

offsetState :Object

Properties:
Name Type Description
enabled boolean
factor number

default: 1
units number

default: 1

renderQueue :number

Determines the order in which an object is drawn. There are four pre-defined render queues:


  • RenderQueue.BACKGROUND = Rendered before any other objects. Commonly used for skyboxes and the likes (0-999)
  • RenderQueue.OPAQUE = Used for most objects, typically opaque geometry. Rendered front to back (1000-1999)
  • RenderQueue.TRANSPARENT = For all alpha-blended objects. Rendered back to front (2000-2999)
  • RenderQueue.OVERLAY = For overlay effects like lens-flares etc (3000+)

By default materials use the render queue of the shader. See Shader or RenderQueue for more info

shader :Shader

Shader to use when rendering

uniforms :Object

Possible overrides for shader uniforms

wireframe :boolean

Show wireframe on this material

Default Value:
  • false
